author: sky.cactus
content: Is a Beam Sync Witness (what I assume this channel is about) just a Merkle Patritia Proof for a give state entry?

author: mandrigin
content: I know very little about beam sync, but it is a binary format that you can transfer over a wire and from which you can recover a multiproof that has everything needed to execute a block.

author: mandrigin
content: I think witnesses can be used regardless if a client uses beam sync or not.

author: kiwi.eth
content: ^ Witnesses in general describe a merkle proof to provide the information needed verify and execute a given structure

author: kiwi.eth
content: Beam Sync is the only example of it currently but it works because nearly every other node is stateful, if all nodes were Beam Sync it wouldn't be as effective

author: sky.cactus
content: Beam Sync nodes *eventually* end up with the full state though, right?

author: sky.cactus
content: The idea is just that they are Beam Sync to bootstrap, and they work their way to full node I believe?
